Description: Aromas of brambly fruits of the wood, dark chocolate and violet talc pave the way for flavors of cherry, cassis, mocha, dried hillside herbs and a touch of lavender. Sleek tannins and a note of coffee bean make for a satisfying finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Offering vivid strawberries in the nose and full, dusky black fruits on the palate, this full-bodied and appropriately tannic wine craves a grilled lamb chop or eggplant parmigiana.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marimar 2018 Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown Tempranillo (Russian River Valley)

Description: This dark-ruby-colored wine has aromas of brambly fruits of the wood, with touches of cedar and violet. Notes of clove and eucalyptus are joined by exquisite flavors of cherry, cassis, dark chocolate and orange zest. Downy tannins carry on into an enduring finish. Drink now through 2044.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Muga 2019 Aro  (Rioja)Cellar Selection

Description: Aromas of dark plum, cassis and herbes de Provence pave the way for flavors of black cherry, purple fig, cocoa powder, espresso bean and violet, with touch of black-olive paste. Durable tannins and brilliant acidity play on the palate and stay for a while. Drink now through 2039.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Cuenta Viñas 2019 El Tiznado  (Rioja)Cellar Selection

Description: This wine has a nose of black currant, coffee bean and butterscotch. It is smooth in the mouth, with satiny tannins and flavors of black cherry, raspberry, milk chocolate, anisette and lavender that evaporate into a floral-strewn finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Viñedos de Paganos 2019 La Nieta  (Rioja)

Description: Deep-violet in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of slightly brambly fruits of the wood and a hint of lavender. Dark chocolate and caramel open on the palate, joined by plush tannins and flavors of pomegranate, cherry and orange zest that wend their way towards a lingering finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: CVNE 2018 Real de Asúa  (Rioja)
